required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of C-MAC Video-stylet Versus Fiberoptic Bronchoscope for Awake Intubation
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of C-MAC Video-stylet Versus Fiberoptic Bronchoscope for Awake Intubation in Patients With Predicted Difficult Airway

brief_summary.textblock: C-MAC- Video Stylet is a completely new type of video endoscope. It combines the advantages of both rigid and flexible intubation endoscopes.

detailed_description.textblock: C-MAC-VS can be connected easily to the same C- MAC monitor and Pocket Monitor without requiring any additional light source and camera. This device is great for cases with limited mouth opening, airway obstruction and difficult intubation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The patients will be randomly assigned into two equal groups using computer-generated randomization technique. The first group (VS group) will include patients undergoing awake intubation using the C-MAC VS. The second control group (FOB group) will include patients undergoing awake intubation using the flexible fibreoptic bronchoscope.

primary_outcome.measure: the time required for a wake intubation
primary_outcome.description: assess the time required for a wake intubation using C-MAC VS versus FOB in patients with anticipated difficult airway.

arm_group.description: include patients undergoing awake intubation using the C-MAC VS
will include patients undergoing awake intubation using the flexible fibreoptic bronchoscope.

intervention.description: The first group (VS group) will include patients undergoing awake intubation using the C-MAC VS
The second control group (FOB group) will include patients undergoing awake intubation using the flexible fibreoptic bronchoscope.
